instructions.start:
An open-source, self-hosted memo hub with knowledge management and socialization.

See https://usememos.com for more details.

AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID.title: AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID

KUBECONFIG.description: Path to an existing Kubernetes config file. If not provided, and no other connection options are provided, and the KUBECONFIG environment variable is not set, the default location will be used (~/.kube/config.json).
KUBECONFIG.title: KUBECONFIG

as.description: Username to impersonate for the operation
as.title: as

as-group.description: Groups to impersonate for the operation
as-group.title: as-group

context.description: The name of a context found in the config file. If not set the current-context will be used.
context.title: context

credential.description: token_type is either "api_key" or "password" (default is "password") Its "keys" map can have the following values: "cert_file": Path to a cert file for the certificate authority "ca_cert": Path to a client certificate file for TLS "key_file": Path to a client key file for TLS
credential.title: credential

api_server.description: The address and port of the Kubernetes API server
api_server.title: Kubernetes Cluster API Base URL

cluster_ca_certificate.description: PEM-encoded root certificates bundle for TLS authentication
cluster_ca_certificate.title: CA certificate

insecure.description: If true, the server's certificate will not be checked for validity. This will make your HTTPS connections insecure
insecure.title: insecure

namespace.description: The default namespace scope to use
namespace.title: namespace
